Jekyll Setup

by Raphael Dumas on July 28, 2015 under jekyll
1 minute read

There is one rather important thing missing from the otherwise excellent jekyll gh-pages tutorial on github.

You could almost fork any jekyll gh-pages theme and it would run out of the box, but for two things:
1. You have to push an initial commit to the gh-pages branch in order to get github to build the page.
2. For a project page, (as opposed to a user page), if you want the css stylings to appear (a big part of the appeal of jekyll) you have to edit the baseurl variable in _config.yml to be the projectâ€™s name, ex: baseurl: "/projectname". Note the leading / but no trailing one.
jekyll, css
I feedback.
